title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: This process took about two months; was a very easy process. I went through an initial phone interview, a 30 minute Zoom interview, a marketing project showcasing your writing abilities, and then an in-person interview on campus. The people were very nice and took me on a golf cart tour around campus. The process was very smooth but I declined due to the salary being insufficient for me (around $40k).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Jacksonville University?

title: Advancement Content Creator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their website directly. I had a phone interview with the hiring manager, and was asked to create a mock email for alumni asking for university donations. After this (about 4 days later) they asked that I create some design examples for their Dolphin Dash initiative. After another 3-4 days, they requested an in person interview. Talk of compensation wasn't discussed at this point. The on-campus interview was from 9:30 AM-11:30 AM (I had to take personal PTO for this). I met with the marketing team who interviewed me (3 individuals) and then met with the advancement team (another 3 people). They were very friendly - both of those interviews lasted about 25 minutes. After this the hiring manager and the director took me on a golf cart tour of the university. This felt very strange as I had not been given an offer, or even discussed compensation yet. They sat down with me at their boathouse area and felt like they were trying to smooze me into wanting to accept a low offer. When the director found out I had a daughter, she kept saying things about the 'work flexibility' to be off on fridays during the summer and a winter break. That all is great, but not for crappy pay. I never heard back from them. A tip for future interviews- follow up with your interviewees. Don't tell them 'we love you and want to negotiate pay' and then never follow up. Over all it was a negative experience since I had to take PTO at my current job to go to the campus to have this strange experience. I heard the pay is around $40,000/year. They talk highly of benefits but that is simply put: not a livable wage. I wouldn't have accepted an offer that low, and wouldn't recommend this department to any of my colleagues searching for an opportunity.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite adobe software? What creative work have you done for your current job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Jacksonville University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was conducted via a phone call. The second interview was conducted via another phone call. The third interview was to be a Zoom meeting, but I was disqualified for the position due to a relative working for the University already.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working for an academic institution that delivers on-line, degree programs?

title: Senior Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was just a one on one with the potential manager. She was so friendly and I loved talking to her! Before I was about to move to the next round, I accepted another job offer.
Interview Questions: Describe your favorite work day

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online and received interview invitation after about 15 days. The first round interview is a virtual interview online for about 20mins. Did not hear back from the search committee after that.
Interview Questions: Talk about your teaching experience

title: Student Assistant - Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very comfortable and easy going. Although they asked great questions, they were also able to make me feel comfortable and were very friendly with me during the whole process.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Marketing Coordinator - Enrollment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: Initially, there was a quick call interview to set the basis and standard for the position itself. Followed with a Zoom call interview with the team the position would be working with. Great team and great interview.
Interview Questions: What is one facet of digital marketing that you would do away with?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions:
Very challenging but overall fair process! The process was thorough. A lot of
Questions regarding , what would you do scenarios. Tell me about a time when? Teaching style? What would you do if you caught a student cheating?
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Intense all say process with multiple committee. Paid for working lunch and had a faculty assigned to take you to each of the 7 interviews. Everyone was nice and I enjoyed the process. Required presentation
Interview Questions: What is the importance of accreditation?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: 2 steps process, they interview you with the entire team, very relaxed and nice. The culture is very laid back but definitely wear a suit to interview and have questions available to ask. If you are looking for a place to get your undergrad or masters while working this is a very good place to work.
Interview Questions: What were you involved in during your undergrad

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University
Interview Descriptions: I absolutely loved my interview process. I got to meet campus partners, students, and potential coworkers. Though I did not get the job, I still love the University and staff that I met.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I could implement customer service in a university setting. Apparently the President of the University is an advocate for providing quality customer service to the students and families.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Meetings with colleagues and administrators.  Teaching demonstrations.  Performance demonstration.  Suspicious dean.  Unprofessional chair.  We had moved here for my husband's job so I was willing to tolerate a less than optimal experience. Lowballed with salary.  No raises in 2 years then a merit raise that was split with the college.  Then no more raise for 4 years.... Merit or cost of living.
Interview Questions: What my academic interests were.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (JAX Beach, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel of 3 and they ask many questions - what was my teaching methods.  Tell me about your worse day.  Why do you want to teach.  Describe the perfect student.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: International Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
have to do a presentation - they want to see how well you perform in a public setting.
There was a panel afterwards as the entire department is a huge influence on the decision process. They're a close-knit community so they want to make sure you have the right kind of energy flow for them.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about travelling?

title: Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had the first interview, simple. It was with the Helpdesk Manager,  the director of operations, and the manager of phone services. They asked me about my work history, and why I was interested in the job. It was very laid back considering you were being analyzed by three different people. The first interview went well. Maybe a week later I had an interview with the Helpdesk manager again, the lead technician and the Helpdesk coordinator. That's where I was asked the more technical questions. Also simple. The questions weren't difficult but they did move rather quickly when asking the questions (my guess is to see how quickly you can get the correct answer out). Again, stressful because it was an interview but also very laid back.
Interview Questions: How do you handle irate customers?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jacksonville University in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter through email and received a response within a couple weeks. My boss happened to by in my area for work, so I had an in=person interview. It was very casual yet professional. I got the job on the spot!
Interview Questions: What would you do for an athlete who lacks confidence?

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jacksonville University (Jacksonville, FL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very smooth. Had two interviews and then was hired. Made initial contact by email answering a want ad, phone call to arrange a 1 on 1 meeting, then a second meeting that included the final decision maker. Offered the job on the spot. They just wanted to know if I could do the job since it initially was to be temporary.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. The interviews were very friendly and straightforward.
